prompt.p: A 42-year-old man develops cervical lymphadenopathy. A fine needle aspirate reveals binucleate Reed-Sternberg cells.
From which of the following diseases does this man suffer?

modalFeedback.p:
Option D (Hodgkin's lymphoma) is Correct. Reed-Sternberg is the pathognomonic cell in Hodgkin's lymphoma.
Option A (Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia) is Incorrect. It is mostly seen in children.
Option B (Acute myeloid leukaemia) is Incorrect. Fine needle aspirate would reveal Auer rod cells.
Option C (Chronic myelogenous leukaemia) is Incorrect. This is associated with the Philadelphia chromosome.
Option E (Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma) is Incorrect. This is a spectrum of lymphoma diseases all of which do not contain the Reed-Sternberg cell.
